Symptoms.Name: Overwhelming workload
Questions: Do you often feel overwhelmed by numerous assignments or tasks?
Do you struggle to balance coursework and other activities?
Symptoms.Advice: Try breaking tasks into smaller parts and setting achievable goals.

Symptoms.Name: Exam fear
Questions: Do you feel panicked or scared when thinking about exams?
Do you worry about disappointing your parents due to poor exam performance?
Symptoms.Advice: Practice relaxation techniques and focus on self-encouragement.

Symptoms.Name: Memory and comprehension issues
Questions: Do you find it hard to concentrate while studying?
Do you struggle to retain information after studying?
Symptoms.Advice: Develop a structured study plan and take regular breaks to improve focus.

Symptoms.Name: Social isolation
Questions: Do you feel disconnected from your classmates or friends?
Do you find it hard to communicate with others about your academic stress?
Symptoms.Advice: Participate in group activities or seek support from trusted friends or counselors.

Symptoms.Name: Procrastination
Questions: Do you find yourself delaying tasks until the last minute?
Do you struggle to start working on assignments or studying?
Symptoms.Advice: Create a fixed schedule and use time management techniques to avoid procrastination.

Symptoms.Name: Performance pressure
Questions: Do you feel constant pressure to excel academically?
Do you fear failing to meet your own or others' expectations?
Symptoms.Advice: Focus on setting realistic goals and prioritize self-care to reduce pressure.

Symptoms.Name: Sleep disturbances
Questions: Do you have trouble falling asleep because of academic worries?
Do you wake up feeling unrested and anxious about schoolwork?
Symptoms.Advice: Maintain a consistent sleep schedule and practice relaxation techniques before bed.

Rules.Action: Suggest time management strategies and mindfulness exercises.
Focus on improving study techniques and reducing distractions.
Encourage communication skills development and group engagement.
Suggest setting achievable daily goals and practicing self-compassion.
Provide resources for managing sleep hygiene and reducing nighttime anxiety.
